title: 100 Days CSS
text: An easy start into the challenge with a custom build number with gradient.

title: Menu Icon
text: Used on almost every website by now, simple but impressively animated it becomes a real eye-catcher.

title: The Pyramide
text: Not as challenging as the real pyramids in Egypt, but the shadow path is not easy.

title: Loading
text: The best are always websites that do not need a loading status. If they do, here would be a calming one.

title: Statistic
text: In a world of numbers, it is important to be able to interpret them correctly. Beautiful statistics help to capture these data.

title: Profile
text: Who of you knows how many social media profiles you have already created? For a refreshing twist, you can also create one yourself.

title: Notifications, Search and Menu
text: The three cornerstones of any application? Brought together in the smallest possible space.

title: Metaballs
text: At first glance impossible to implement with CSS, but filters make this possible too.

title: Rainy Night
text: The perfect time of day and the perfect weather to program in peace. The raindrops even shatter on the ground.

title: Watch
text: Classic, noble, modern or playful? What do you want your favorite watch to look like?.

title: Walking Boots
text: These boots are made for walking. Where are they going and for how long?.

title: Tooltip
text: I'm quite sure, you already know what obsession means. But you can look it up anyways.

title: User Gallery
text: An idea for a transition between user overview and profile page.

title: Byciclopter
text: Which side of the card do you want to use? Either drive or fly to work in the morning?.

title: Upload
text: Yes, you can actually drag and drop a file in there. But don't worry, the upload process is faked.

title: Blobby
text: It appears, wobbles, changes its shape and disappears again. Just like that.

title: Penrose Triangle
text: CSS makes even the impossible possible. Can you find out how it was done?.

title: Elastic
text: I thought for a long time about the best way to achieve this effect. In the end, the solution was easier than expected.

title: Slider with Radio Buttons
text: Why use JavaScript when you can use CSS? Selectors can be wildly combined with each other.

title: Send Mail
text: Surprise your visitors with a nice animation instead of a simple 'request sent'.

title: Pac-Man
text: Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Waka Wakaâ€¦

title: Fitness Tracker
text: Don't sit on your chair all day long. Get up, jump, run, exercice and burn some calories.

title: Animated Typography
text: Some big, bold and beautiful animated typography will enhance every boring header section.

title: Button
text: Do you really wanna let your users guess if their actions were successful? No! So give them some feedback if they click a button.

title: Map Marker
text: Did I just placed a marker in the middle of some water to get a nice color contrast? Maybe. Click on it for a nice transition.

title: Motivational Modal
text: What's worse than a motivational quote? Three motivational quotes... so don't focus on the text and click through them quickly.

title: Checklist
text: What's the great thing about working through your to-do list? That's right, the relieving feeling when you can check off the tasks.

title: Ring Ring
text: Fortunately for you, I left out the alarm sound. But hopefully the signal color and the movement have served their purpose.

title: Search Field
text: You won't find anything unless you start looking. So go ahead, write something in the search box.

title: Random Line
text: What can I say, it is a line. A line that moves and circles something. What should it be? That's for you to decide.

title: Pendulum Wave
text: If you are not yet fascinated by mathematics, you should be now at the latest. Wonderful what a small calculations brings forth.

title: Counter
text: I wonder how high or low is the maximum you can count here? The transitions are pure CSS, but I used some JS for the counting.

title: Sunny Day
text: What else could be visible on this sunny day? Some birds, plains or even superman?.

title: Hello
text: Yes, another animation of some text. But this time I used SVGs as a base. What kind of animation will you make?.

title: Loading Circle
text: Is that a dark circle with a white stripe or the other way around?.

title: Tabs
text: The solution for layouts with little space or many navigation levels.

title: Carousel
text: Images, quotes, prices or logos. A carousel can be used in many ways and is an eye-catcher.

title: Logo Transition
text: Logos don't always have to be static, as a transition or stylistic element they can have animations.

title: Menu Toggle
text: What looks like another simple menu icon turns out to be a full-fledged navigation.

title: Gallery
text: Take a closer look by clicking on the images. The animations are CSS only and precalculated.

title: Error Modal
text: Don't worry, it's not a real error, this is part of the challenge.

title: Stars
text: If you look closely, you can see the stars sparkling. And with a bit of luck, you might even spot a shooting star. Make a wish!

title: Lightbulb
text: Light on, light off, light on, light off, light on.

title: Twisted Pyramid
text: Impressive how quickly squares can become a spiral.

title: Button
text: If normal hover effects aren't enough for you anymore, try this.

title: Iris Circles
text: What do you see? Camera shutter, tornado, flower or dancing people from above?

title: Pixel Art
text: Don't you like the Google Dinosaur? No problem, click on the pixels to create your own piece of art.

title: 3D Cube
text: With CSS you can work not only two-dimensional but also three-dimensional. Simple objects and animation are no problem.

title: CSS Follow
text: It wouldn't be a big challenge to implement that with JS only, but with CSS you have to come up with a good solution.

title: Easter Egg
text: Are you familier with the 12 Basic Principles of Animation? This is an example for squash and stretch.

title: CSS Counter
text: You think with CSS you can't count to a thousand and even pause the whole thing at the push of a button? Then take a look at the code.

title: Dot Wave
text: I feel like I go into hypnosis if I stare at it too long.
